III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section Program statement
Description (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation There are concerns with the facility's medical staff conducting
medication reviews without parent guardian or therapist present.
Floor staff aren’t properly trained to handle the youth. This place is
very wild and unprofessional. There’s lack of structure.
Investigation Complainant was anonymous.
Foster Care Worker was interviewed via telephone on
08/22/2025. Foster Care Worker stated Youth A has been placed
at the facility for one year. She reported Youth A has had several
medication reviews and she has not been notified to attend the
medication reviews. She said Youth A receives Adderall
medication and this was discontinued on 08/06/2025. Foster Care
Worker expressed no other concern regarding staff or the facility.
Administrator was interviewed at the facility on 08/25/2025.
Administrator reported the medical team schedules medication
reviews and notified Therapist of the appointments. Administrator
reported she is not aware of any incident where medication was
changed without parent/guardian approvals. Administrator said
shift coordinators and managers are on the pods to ensure staff
are mentored and supported. She said weekly meetings and
training courses are held with staff to ensure staff have the tools
necessary to do their jobs. Administrator said she is not aware of
issues or concerns related to reporting they don’t have the
appropriate training to do their jobs.
Nurse was interviewed at the facility on 08/25/2025 and on
09/10/2025. Nurse is the head nurse for both facilities. She
reported medication reviews are scheduled with the psychiatrist
and are entered in the shared calendar for the therapist to notify
parent/guardians. She said when medication changes are made
the forms are sent to the parent/guardians to sign before
medication can be changed. She said no new medication can be
2

prescribed without the parent/guardian approval. Nurse denied
witnessing or youths reporting staff are unable to control the
youths.
Youth A was interviewed at the facility on 08/25/2025. Youth A
has been at the facility for one year. Youth A refused to answer
any other questions and walked out of the room.
Youth B was interviewed at the facility on 08/25/2025. Youth B
has been at the facility for one month. Youth B reported he takes
medication, and no changes have been made to his medication.
Youth B said there are always 2 or 3 staff on the pod, and he
expressed no concerns regarding staff supervision. Youth B
reported he gets enough to eat, participates in outside and gym
activities, and feels safe.
Youth C was interviewed at the facility on 08/25/2025. Youth C
has been at the facility for seven months and is placed on Pod H.
Youth C reported he takes medication and has met with the
psychiatrist but has not had any medication changes. Youth C
reported there are always two staff supervising and redirecting
youths if there are any issues on the pod. Youth C reported he
participates in weekly therapy sessions and group therapy. Youth
C expressed no concerns regarding staff or the facility.
Youth D was interviewed at the facility on 08/25/2025. Youth D
has been at the facility for one year. He reported he is prescribing
medication and has seen the psychiatrist several times since his
placement. Youth D could not recall if the doctor has made any
changes to his medication. Youth D reported he gets his
medication daily. Youth D said there are always staff supervising
and staff will redirect if youths are escalated. Youth D did not have
any concerns regarding staff or the facility.
Staff 1 and Staff 2 were interviewed at the facility on 09/17/2025.
Staff 1 and Staff 2 are trained in medication dispensing. Staff 1
and Staff 2 reported they mentor and coach direct care staff to
ensure direct care staff have the tools and support to provide care
and supervision to the youth. Staff 1 and Staff 2 expressed no
concern regarding staff not being able to handle the youths or
being unprofessional. Staff 1 and Staff 2 reported when a youth is
escalated staff are trained to verbally de-escalate and radio for
assistance if the situation calls for it.
Therapist was interviewed at the facility on 08/26/2025 and on
09/28/2025. Therapist reported the facility has two psychiatrists
3

that complete medication reviews. She reported that youths’
medication reviews are scheduled by the nurse and entered in the
shared calendar. The therapist or case manager are present for
medication reviews and notify the parent and worker if a
medication change is requested by the psychiatrist. She said
typically it is hard to get the worker and parent to participate in the
appointments because the medical team will schedule ten youths
to have medication reviews and therefore, they are not provided
with the exact time of the appointment. This makes it challenging
to get the youth’s workers and parents to participate during the
appointment. She said the facility is trying to coordinate with the
medical team to come up with a more accurate schedule to
accommodate the parents and workers that want to be present for
the medication review. She is not aware of any incident where
medication was added without parental/guardian authorization.
She said written authorization is not required when the psychiatrist
discontinues medication.
Documents Reviewed:
• Youth A’s Initial Treatment plan and Updated treatment
plan dated 09/26/2024 through 07/01/2025. Youth A’s
psychiatric case note dated 08/06/2025 states Adderall was
discontinued.
• Email from Therapist dated 09/29/2025. On 8/6/2025 Youth
A had a medication review where his Adderall was
discontinued. His Foster Care Worker/legal guardian was
informed on 8/11/2025 during the case conference for the
month. Youth A had medications changed again on
9/3/2025, and Foster Care Worker was present in person
for the medication review at that time.
• Spectrum Health Services Policy and Procedures state all
medication administrated to youth are to be ordered in
writing by the agency physician.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance based on interviews and
documentation provided as the facility policy does not require the
parent/guardian to be present for medication reviews and staff are
following this policy.
• Technical assistance was provided to the facility to improve
the scheduling for medication reviews, so that parents and
guardians can be notified when medication reviews are
scheduled ahead of time.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142
Section Health services; policies and procedures.
Description (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(e) Dispensing medication.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation There is only one nurse on campus to care for 100 kids and must
put medication out every day at both buildings Calumet and
Lincoln. A lot of medication errors keep occurring.
Investigation Nurse was interviewed at the facility on 08/25/2025 and on
09/10/2025. Nurse reported the facility has three nurses and one
medical assistance that order and fill medication for the youths.
She reported nurse fills the medication cart and the trained staff
dispense the medication and document in QuickMar. She said
there are four staff trained to pass medication for each building.
She said in the month of August there were some medication
issues; on 08/22/25 and 08/24/25 a few dosages of medication
were found left on the medication cart and On 08/21/2025,
QuickMar documentation was not recorded when youths refuse
medication or if medication was on the cart. There were 10 youths
that had missing dosage for the month of August, 2025. She said
the medication concerns were discussed during the management
meeting and the management team is working with the clinical
team on a new process to address the issues with medication
dispensing.
Administrator was interviewed at the facility on 08/25/2025. She
acknowledged there has been some concerns identified regarding
medication dispensing and this was discussed in the management
meeting on 08/15/2025. She said the facility is in the process of
making changes to the medication dispensing process to address
these concerns.
Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility on 09/17/2025. She
reported she is trained in medication dispensing. She reported
medication cart is filled with the medication by the nurse. She said
when she is dispensing medication each youth is called to come
to the med cart on the pod, the medication is scanned and
provided to the youth. She said once the youth takes the
medication she documents in QuickMar medication status. She is
not aware of missed medication. She said sometimes if there is an
issue with QuickMar may not register the medication has been
dispensed. She said if a youth refuses the medication, she
5

documents that in QuickMar and has the youth sign that they
refused the medication.
Staff 2 was interviewed at the facility on 09/17/2025. He is trained
in medication dispensing. Staff 2 reported there has been some
incident where youths’ medication were not on the cart. He said if
medication is missing, he would document in QuickMar and notify
the clinic that the medication was missing.
Documents Reviewed:
• Spectrum Medication Administration Procedure only shift
coordinators/managers and medical staff will dispense
medication. Dispense medication on time. Dispense the
medication from the youth’s individual packet into clear
medication cup. Count the number of pills to be given from
the medication book against the number of pills in the
medication cup. Stay with the youth until medication is
swallowed, check their mouth, hands, and cup to ensure
medication is taken. Complete the medication
administration record in the QuickMar system immediately
after distribution.
• Reviewed QuickMar record for August and found 10 Youths
had missed medication and it is not documented if youths
refused or the medication was missing.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance in dispensing youths’
medication as prescribed based on interviews some youths did
not receive their medication, and some medication was found to
be left on the medication cart after staff dispense medication.
Conclusion Violation Established
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
